intro: Fimbristylis nesiotis, commonly known as the New Zealand hair sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as swamps, marshes, and along streambanks. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets. Fimbristylis nesiotis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
